response.original_title: Blue and White in Red Square
response.overview: On July 15, 1998, 1,000 musicians representing 11 Youth Philharmonic Orchestras from around the world gathered to form the "Orchestra of the World" in Moscow's Red Square. Among them was the Young Israeli Philharmonic, many of whom were born in the Soviet Union. In his unique visual style and artistic sense of storytelling, Director Elan Frank draws us into the stories of the Israeli Russian immigrants returning to non-Communist Russia for the first time.
response.title: Blue and White in Red Square
